why must a user add manually a site (in this case my blog) to somewhere? it should be done automatically. Do you want to waste our time like that ?
I am sure my blog is well-known throught the zero network. it should be grabbed automatically by some kind of bot. If it is not included the index made there is bad
logo: I see it was redacted who posted it, not you: click in menu above "current polls: logo"
it may be easy for you, but you are throwing the work to the users, which is "lame"
at least, and wasting my/our time

poll <- pool

great, @0penworld@zv
not sure if possible, but I can also transfer the domain right when I have itto you
and you can do whatever you like
just give me the costs I had for registering
yeah, single mining is nearly impossible
you can convert coins from x to nmc via shapeshift. actually, you could, before they went offline due to the hack. BUt they will surely get online soon again
you can also get NMC from other places: e.g. poloniex, kraken and so surel yhave it
well, nothing is really anonym in the inet. Even if I register now for you, later you have to renew and pay, so they will trace it back to somewhere
renewal is about every 6-7 months, and costs also
not sure ho wmuch, I haven't yet renewed any .bit myself
tor i snot a protection
I like i2p more: https://geti2p.net/en/comparison/tor https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tor_%28anonymity_network%29#Weaknesses
getting NMC anonymously: Jeremy, main dev of Namecoin itself says and said that
I think the best he said was: mine via monero (CPU) and do it from cubeos or so
but that still wouldn't be complete
i2p, tor: could be. I haven't audited any of them
well, then look into this monero thing first, when you can get money from there. you can convert to namecoin
well, if you want to "make spying more expensive", shit on the .bit and just have the normal ZN address
people can just bookmark over time

you can use vanitygen, it will cost cpu, but it makes the human mind better read the ZN address

you should note that on that page
2. every title has at end. "- ZeroNet" <- you can remove that. show only the important thing to the user
udp tracker: ok, please write to the page, or people think it's wrong
3. the diff -1 or +2: to which time interval is this ?
1h, 24h 7 weeks ?
please also add the info to the page
4. make the peer number itself not in red: red is normally something dangerful
4b. why is the "+2" in red, and the "-1" in green ? I'd expect the opposite

hi @flyer@zv welcome to a new world :-)
@redacted@zv if you get the echoes from @erkan, then it works!
@redacted@zv: when you get again "content publish failed": look in your logs or the terminal where you started zeronet.py: a more explaining error message will be shown
@redacted@zv it should work, because I see your messages to the bot, and also: the bot replied
just sent a msg to the bot, and got 1 second later a reply. can you try again ?
yes
2nd test: let me send from another account a mail, if you get it
sent
I see your test2
and also bot immediately replied
now the question is: why don't you get it? e.g. works for me here fro my 2nd account
"I'm wondering if the problem is that I initially registered (on ZeroMail) with my zeroid.bit ID?" <- should not matter. I have sent to both a mail from my 2nd account. check both please
there is a log out button on the top left bottom. do you see it ?
"can I delete the site?" wait please, it should work. let's investigate
try to log out now and log in with the other account and send mails form there
yes, I see as sender different redacted@zeroid and redacted@zeroverse
when you are logged in as redacted@zeroid.bit: please press f5 and strg+shift+r, perhaps the cache is just playing a trick
strg is the name for the control-key here on my keyboard
it is on the bottom left on the keyboard
/me will look now if you have really 2 accounts here or not, in the data dir
you have 2, I will send you via mail the info
/me sent to the zeroid.bit
let me sign/republish the mail@zeroverse also again!
yes, I can not see what it is. but I see that it is more in size than the zeroid bit: zeroid has 859bytes, and zeroverse has: 1.3KB
and both accounts have also different "sign(s)" in their content.json
can you send from both a mail again? then we see, if the data.json increases for both
OK, I see in your zeroverse dir, the size increased from 1.3KB to 2KB
but I didn't get the mail yet, let's wait a little
please send now also a mail from your zeroid
"Everything I've sent shows up in my sent folder": good, and if there was no red error msg, it should arrive at my inbox
how many peers did it publish to? when you send it says in green: published to x peers
ok, that is fine

yes, see FAQ: "How different is mail@zeroverse from ZeroMail?" -> "     As with every site/app on ZeroNet: if you read/use a ZN site, it gets stored on your HD. So, all of its data." http://127.0.0.1:43110/mail.zeroverse.bit/faq.html
see also in FAQ: "Privacy and anonymity" -> "Others can know when you sent a mail, and how many mails you sent. BUT: they won't know to whom you sent it."
so, did you get my mail about the 2 dirs ?
yeah, I only sent it to zeroid
let me send to the zeroverse also again. did you send a mial from your zeroid, so we can see the data file size being increased
ok, I see your zeroid dir has also increased: from 859bytes to 1.5KB
it must not be online, since mail@zeroverse is syned with the peers
well, sending email is just as you say modifying files, so the modification will reach mail@zeroverse ones. BUT, important:
1. R sends the modifications
2. the receiver X is a direct neighbour of the 5 peers you sent this to: X gets it immediately. probabyl before it reaches mail@zeroverse even
3. if X is on a far island: the modification will reach it sooner or later
to 3: since all mail@zeroverse users have always a copy of mail@zeroverse and sync
well, each user has a own folder, and I see that you have done something, since the size increases
so it must have synced correct to me, and if it synced to me correct: for all others also, I assume
yes -> "but when you send me a mail it doesn't go into my folder, right? it goes into your folder"

"how to allow zeroverse users in a more obvious place." <- like this? "III. how to allow ZeroVerse.bit users on my site?" http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:15:get+yourself+an+ID+@+ZeroVerse.bit
but something is strange, I have not received any mails by you yet. last mail only from 55 mins ago
how are you connecting your ZN ? I assume over tor. Me too
"I have not received any mails by you yet" <- but for my 2 accounts, on different connections: they get mails to each other
@redacted@zv ok, let's debug later more. have a nice time!

phones, as in smartphones
